name: os
summary: A Node.js-compatible implementation of the core os module

methods.name: arch
methods.summary:
Returns the operating system CPU architecture for which the binary was compiled. Possible values are return 'arm', 'arm64', 'ia32', 'x64', 'mips', and 'unknown'.

The return value is equivalent to arch. Relates strongly to architecture.

methods.name: cpus
methods.summary: Returns an array of objects containing information about each logical CPU core.

methods.name: endianness
methods.summary:
Returns a string identifying the endianness of the CPU for which the binary was compiled.

Possible values are 'BE' for big endian and 'LE' for little endian.

Related to getNativeByteOrder() on Titanium.

methods.name: freemem
methods.summary: Returns the amount of free system memory in bytes as an integer.

methods.name: getPriority
methods.summary:
Returns the scheduling priority for the process specified by pid. If pid is not provided or is 0, the priority of the current process is returned.

Titanium's shim, will always return 0.

parameters.name: pid
parameters.summary: The process ID to retrieve scheduling priority for.

methods.name: homedir
methods.summary: Returns the string path of the current user's home directory.
methods.description: On Titanium, returns the same value as applicationDataDirectory.

methods.name: hostname
methods.summary: Returns the host name of the operating system as a string. On Titanium, this will return the value of address

methods.name: loadavg
methods.summary:
Returns an array containing the 1, 5, and 15 minute load averages.

On Titanium, the return value is always [0, 0, 0].

methods.name: networkInterfaces
methods.summary:
Returns an object containing network interfaces that have been assigned a network address.

Each key on the returned object identifies a network interface. The associated value is an array of objects that each describe an assigned network address.

On Titanium, an empty object ({}) is always returned.

methods.name: platform
methods.summary:
Returns a string identifying the operating system platform. Possible values are 'android', 'iphone', 'ipad', 'windowsphone', and 'windowsstore'.

The return value is equivalent to platform.

On Titanium, this is equivalent to osname.

methods.name: release
methods.summary:
Returns the operating system as a string.

On Titanium, this is equivalent to version.

methods.name: setPriority
methods.summary:
Attempts to set the scheduling priority for the process specified by pid. If pid is not provided or is 0, the process ID of the current process is used.

On Titanium, this method is a no-op.

parameters.name: pid
parameters.summary: The process ID to set scheduling priority for.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.summary: The scheduling priority to assign to the process.

methods.name: tmpdir
methods.summary:
Returns the operating system's default directory for temporary files as a string.

On Titanium, this is equivalent to tempDirectory.

methods.name: totalmem
methods.summary:
Returns the total amount of system memory in bytes as an integer.

On Titanium, this is equivalent to <Ti.Platform.totalMemory>.

methods.name: type
methods.summary:
Returns the operating system as a string.

On Titanium, this returns 'Darwin' for iOS, or 'Linux' for Android. May return 'Unknown' for others.

methods.name: uptime
methods.summary:
Returns the system uptime in number of seconds.

On Titanium, this is equivalent to uptime.

methods.name: userInfo
methods.summary: Returns information about the currently effective user.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary: Simple object with encoding property. Ignored on Titanium.

properties.name: constants
properties.summary: Contains commonly used operating system-specific constants for error codes, process signals, and so on.

constants.name: EOL
constants.summary:
The operating system-specific end-of-line marker.

\n on POSIX \r\n on Windows
